result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:06 AM Defendant Raheem S Colas in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews defendant's petition for appointment of counsel, Court appoints Atty Nils Wyosnick at the rate of $100.00 per hour, defendant to reimburse Columbia County at the rate of $150.00 per month commencing 10/15/22, matter to be reset for pretrial/return date,

Pretrial 9-19-22 at 2:10 PM and Return date 9-28-22 at 9:00 AM
No violent or abusive contact with C.N.H., her residence, work place, or vehicle. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Standard felony conditions.

1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Raheem S Colas appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gibson D Hatch appeared by video for Raheem S Colas. Waived reading of complaint. Advisement of rights. Bond recommendations. Court set $25,000.00 signature bond. No violent or abusive contact with C.N.H., her residence, work place, or vehicle. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Standard felony conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 1:33 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:10 pm.
Return date scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
